name: DiCarlo Lab Datasets
tagline: Public Neural Datasets for Encoding Models
body:
### DLData Public
In order to stimulate the development of encoding models of visual cortex we have made several large scale neural datasets publicly available via a github repository. This site is intended to describe the format of those datasets, how to submit the predictions of encoding models, and how results will be calculated and posted.

### Data format
We have modeled the format of the datasets after [skdata](http://jaberg.github.io/skdata/), a format for standard machine learning datasets.

Each dataset is a python object which has attached

+  images (as an [skdata lazy array](https://github.com/jaberg/skdata/blob/master/skdata/larray.py))
+  metadata about these images (as a [tabular array](http://web.mit.edu/yamins/www/tabular/modules/tabular.tab.html)) 
+  neural data (as a [numpy array](http://www.numpy.org/)), a vector of responses for each image

``` python
import dldatapublic.neural_datasets as nd
dataset = nd.PNAS2010()
images = dataset.images  #not yet loaded in memory
im0 = images[0]  #loaded in memory as a numpy array
meta = dataset.meta
print meta['category'][0]  #'car'
print meta['obj'][0]  #'ferrari'
IT_neural_features = dataset.IT_neural_features
V4_neural_features = dataset.V4_neural_features
```
For further documentation, see the tutorials folder. There is a short readme describing the nature of each dataset. Depending on the dataset, neural data is available at a finer grain than simply a vector of responses per image.

### Submitting encoding models

+  Clone and install the dldata_public repository
+  Generate and save an array for one of the test datasets, the same shape as dataset.neural_features
+  Submit a pull request

We require that the code used to generate predictions be made publicly available (on github or otherwise) so that others may run your model on similarly structured datasets. Once we verify these conditions, we will evaluate the models for their predictivity and post the results.

### Results/Methodology
Your predictions will be evaluated using a single-site % variance explained metric, as well as a population level representation dissimilarity metric. As an example, here are the results from the dataset used in our [PNAS 2014 paper](http://www.pnas.org/content/early/2014/05/08/1403112111), where the methodology of these metrics is described.
(Single site neural fit plot for V4 and IT neural data)

The results of predicting neural activity for all datasets in this repository are available [here](broken link).

### Publications
Feel free to explore the data as you wish, but we ask that you contact us before publishing any analysis of this data. If you fail to do so, we reserve the right to contact journal editors and request a withdrawal.

### Support or Contact
If you have any trouble installing or using the datasets, please contact ardila@mit.edu.
